title: Now Might Be The Best Time To Earn One Of WoW's Most Coveted Mounts
description: This week may be the best time to ever earn one of World of Warcraft's most sought-after mounts, Invincible, the steed of the Lich King himself.It's a mount so prestigious that many mount-collecting players run the 15-year-old Icecrown Citadel raid every week on multiple characters for a chance at earning the mount from the Lich King's corpse, usually to no avail.Do the TW raid this week by u/Kisielg in wow But thanks to the Wrath of the Lich King Timewalking event running this week in The War Within, players on Reddit are reporting what seems like a much higher-than-normal chance of earning the mount. The prize is coming not from defeating the Lich King, but from the Cache of Timewarped Treasures quest reward earned by doing the Timewalking version of another Wrath of the Lich King raid, Ulduar.Continue Reading at GameSpot
excerpt: Players on Reddit are sharing their success after earning Invincible during this week's Timewalking event.

html:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

By on October 10, 2024 at 11:33AM PDT

This week may be the best time to ever earn one of World of Warcraft's most sought-after mounts, Invincible, the steed of the Lich King himself.

It's a mount so prestigious that many mount-collecting players run the 15-year-old Icecrown Citadel raid every week on multiple characters for a chance at earning the mount from the Lich King's corpse, usually to no avail.

But thanks to the Wrath of the Lich King Timewalking event running this week in The War Within, players on Reddit are reporting what seems like a much higher-than-normal chance of earning the mount. The prize is coming not from defeating the Lich King, but from the Cache of Timewarped Treasures quest reward earned by doing the Timewalking version of another Wrath of the Lich King raid, Ulduar.

To snag the quest, players need to travel to the Wrath of the Lich King version of Dalaran (easily accessible from each faction's portal room) and pick up the Disturbance Detected: Ulduar quest from the NPCs standing near the fountain with the statues. Players can then use the Group Finder function to find a group running the old raid. Thankfully, only the raid's final boss needs to be defeated for the quest, so players can actually skip most of the raid and run straight to Yogg-Saron to save time.

Players are sharing their success on the WoW subreddit. While it's unclear what exactly the drop rate for Invincible from the Cache of Timewarped Treasures is, it clearly seems to be much higher than defeating the Lich King like usual.

Blizzard recently announced The War Within's first major update, patch 11.0.5, will release on October 22. The update will introduce a huge WoW 20th-anniversary event--one where players will be able to earn updated versions of some of the game's most iconic armor sets, complete Timewalking versions of old dungeons and raids, and more.

There are currently no available deals

GameSpot may get a commission from retail offers.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
